action.action-desc: Mr. Miller of Florida introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 36, United States Code, to make certain improvements in the congressional charter of the Disabled American Veterans.

section.header: Congressional charter of Disabled American Veterans

subsection.text: Section 50302 of title 36, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking The purposes of the corporation are and inserting The corporation is organized exclusively for charitable and educational purposes. The purposes of the corporation shall include—;
in paragraph (6), by striking and at the end;
by redesignating paragraph (7) as paragraph (9); and
by inserting after paragraph (6) the following new paragraphs:
to educate the public about the sacrifices and needs of disabled veterans;
to educate disabled veterans about the benefits and resources available to them; and

subsection.text: Chapter 503 of such title is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.text: On dissolution or final liquidation of the corporation, any assets remaining after the discharge or satisfactory provision for the discharge of all liabilities shall be transferred to the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for the care of disabled veterans.
